section.section: At the times specified in subsection (d) of this section, each regulated lobbyist shall register with the Ethics Commission on a form provided by the Ethics Commission.
A regulated lobbyist shall register separately for each entity that has engaged the regulated lobbyist for lobbying purposes.

text.section: If applicable, each registration shall include the authorization required by § 15-702 of this subtitle.

section.section: A regulated lobbyist who is not currently registered shall register within 5 days after first performing an act that requires registration under this subtitle.
A regulated lobbyist shall file a new registration form on or before November 1 of each year if, on that date, the regulated lobbyist is engaged in lobbying.
Each registration form shall be accompanied by a fee of $100.
The fee shall be credited to the Lobbyist Registration Fund established under § 15-210 of this title.

Except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, each registration shall terminate on the earlier of:
the October 31 following the filing of the registration; or
an earlier termination date specified in an authorization filed with respect to that registration under § 15-702 of this subtitle.

A regulated lobbyist may terminate the registration before the date specified in paragraph (1) of this subsection by:
ceasing all activity that requires registration; and
after ceasing activity in accordance with item (i) of this paragraph:

Subject to subparagraphs (ii) and (iii) of this paragraph, if a regulated lobbyist is or becomes subject to regulation under this title as an official or employee, the regulated lobbyist shall immediately terminate the registration in accordance with paragraph (2) of this subsection.
After holding a public hearing, the Ethics Commission shall adopt regulations establishing criteria under which a regulated lobbyist may serve on a State board or commission.
